title: Make the app mobile-friendly (responsive UI for phones)

requirements.text: Update the UI layout to be mobile-first responsive so the app is comfortable to use on phone screens (approximately 320–430px wide) across the Dashboard and Entries pages, including appropriate spacing, typography scaling, and touch-friendly controls.

quotes: i want this application in mobile

acceptanceCriteria: On phone-sized viewports (320–430px), all primary screens (Dashboard, Entries) render without horizontal scrolling.
Tap targets (primary buttons, navigation buttons, action icons) are comfortably clickable on touch devices (no cramped icon clusters).
Page padding/margins are adjusted so content does not feel overly wide/tall on mobile (e.g., reduce desktop-oriented vertical padding where appropriate).

requirements.text: Improve mobile navigation and header behavior so users can reliably move between Dashboard and Entries on mobile, including ensuring the mobile nav is always accessible and does not overlap content.

quotes: i want this application in mobile

acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, the header and the existing mobile navigation controls remain visible/accessible and do not cause layout overflow.
Navigation controls on mobile clearly indicate the current page and remain usable with one hand (buttons span available width appropriately).

requirements.text: Make the Entries list usable on mobile by adapting the entries table presentation for small screens (e.g., responsive layout that avoids cramped columns), while preserving edit/delete capabilities and existing filters.

quotes: i want this application in mobile

acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, the entries list does not render as an unreadable multi-column table; instead it uses a mobile-friendly layout (such as stacked rows/cards) that shows date, type, amount, and optional category/note clearly.
Edit and delete actions remain available for each entry on mobile without requiring precision tapping.
Existing filters (type and date range) remain usable on mobile, with controls sized and laid out appropriately.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI components must be composed, not edited).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Building a native iOS/Android app (App Store / Play Store).
Adding push notifications, SMS, email, or real-time WebSocket features.
Introducing third-party authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
